content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

Here's an implementation of the `q_and_a_extractor` function in Julia:

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md)
    questions = []
    answers = []

    lines = split(md, '\n'))
    current_question = false
    current_answer = false

    for line in lines
        stripped_line = strip(line)

        if starts_with(stripped_line, "# Question"))
            current_question = true
            current_answer = false
            push!(questions, "")
        elseif current_question && !current_answer && starts_with(stripped_line, "# Answer")))
            current_answer = true
            push!(answers, "")
        elseif current_answer
            push!(answers[end], " ")
            push!(answers[end], stripped_line)
        end
    end

    extracted_answers = Tuple{String, String}[]
    for i in 1:length(questions)
        if length(answers[i]) > 0
            extracted_answers .= [(questions[i]), answers[i]))]
        end
    end

    return extracted_answers
end
```

This function will parse the given markdown `md`, extract Question and Answer sections, and return the tuples containing the questions and answers. The leading spaces and newlines are stripped from the text.
